text: he told us that he was God that the
airforce wasn't gonna believe anything
we said over him that he controlled us
that we were basically worthless and we
were never gonna get anywhere especially
the fact that we were women the sexual
assault scandal at Lackland Air Force
Base the Center for airforce basic
training is unfolding as one of the
largest in military history so far 62
recruits almost all women have been
identified as victims of assault or
other improper conduct by 32 training
instructors between 2009 and 2012 this
is James risin for the New York Times in
an exclusive interview 21-year old
Virginia Messick is the first victim to
speak out publicly about her ordeal she
was raped by her training instructor
Staff Sergeant Lewis Walker in April
2011 when I first got space training
about second week is when he started let
me use email and Facebook to talk to a
friend in Afghanistan which was clearly
a prohibited but he was telling me that
everybody needed a friend while they
were on deployment so I thought I was in
a professional manner
we had just cleaned an upstairs dorm for
a new flight to come in and he asked me
to go and get the detail towels from
upstairs and he told me to come up five
minutes after him so that cameras didn't
catch us coming up at the same time when
I went upstairs to get these tea towel
towels
he was standing behind the door and when
I walked in he pushed it over close
behind me and that's when he proceeded
to rape me and basically told me I was
gonna do what he wanted me to do or I
was gonna get kicked out of the Air
Force or or else at the time I was
blaming myself the way that he makes you
feel when you're in base and any girl in
there would feel that it's they control
you there's nothing you can do about it
no matter what I did he was gonna get to
me and if I would have said something
about it I'd be putting my own career in
jeopardy so I didn't report it I didn't
say anything I didn't talk to anybody
until I told my best friend months later
Messick was approached by Air Force
investigators OSI the investigators they
were they caught me off guard they
basically put me in a room with him and
started talking to me and at that point
I didn't I didn't really recall what
happened to me because I had pushed it
so down deep that I didn't even I
honestly was so blocked out and so numb
to it I just didn't want to even talk
about it
I didn't even and on top of that to
strangers I don't want to talk to
strangers about that
she says she gave investigators a
watered down version of what happened
so Walker was charged with a lesser
offense than rape in her case in July
2012 he was convicted of rape and other
charges involving ten women including
Messick he is now serving a 20-year
sentence Messick left the Air Force in
2012 because of an injury she says she
still suffers from nightmares and wild
emotional swings
symptoms of PTSD after everything it was
just like okay thanks
you know and we talked you know they had
us talk to some senators and senators I
didn't feel really helped they were just
trying to gain ideas from us that they
could put their name on other than that
there was nothing the military was like
you know there's the door thanks for
coming and helping us win but you know
we don't need you anymore to date seven
Air Force instructors have been
court-martialed and
more cases are pending and under
investigation two senior officers have
been relieved of command
